alert.note: Alert for Baldwin; Hancock; Putnam; Warren (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 26 at 10:26AM EDT until March 26 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Baldwin County in central Georgia... Southeastern Putnam County in central Georgia... Hancock County in east central Georgia... Warren County in east central Georgia... * Until 430 PM EDT Sunday. * At 1026 AM EDT, Radar and automated rain gauges have estimated between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Milledgeville, Warrenton, Sparta, Norwood, Camak, Meriwether, Springfield, Culverton, Shoulderbone, Powelton, Devereux, Mayfield, Jewell, Shoals, Underwood, Beall Springs, Oconee Springs Park, Plant Harlee Branch, Cadley and Reese. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
